title: Robust & smart - fit for purpose
body: This little pot has been well used since purchasing a few weeks ago. Love that it is housed securely on a non-slip base and has a comfortable integral handle. Seems quite sturdy and is better protected from the inevitable â€™clonksâ€™ in the sink than the versions that allow you to remove the glass from the frame. Also like the extra synthetic mesh that ensures absolutely no grains whatsoever in the cup. Filled to the top it makes two good sized mugs with a little left over for small top-ups (equivalent to four to six small coffee cups).

title: Best coffee ever!
body:
Ever since I learned of the French Press to make coffee, I've never gone back to the traditional brewing.
The glass in my previous one broke which is why I bought this one to replace. Coffee has never tasted better or more fresh.
This size is perfect for one person in that it makes about 2 large cups! Highly recommend.

Die Kanne lÃ¤sst selbst jap. Fukamushi GrÃ¼ntee nicht durch das Sieb dringen. Genial. Der Tee kann frei schwimmen und ich kann sogar mehrere perfekte AufgÃ¼sse machen. Klare Kaufempfehlung! title: Serves its purpose though no scoop
body:
Just finished the coffee I made after receiving this today.

The only gripe I have is that it didnâ€™t come with a scoop as the pictures suggest.

The suggested 7g per 100ml is probably also off as I made 2 decent mugs worth which equates to 49g by their suggestion which was incredibly bitter and this is coming from someone who enjoys strong coffee.

Other than that I had no grounds in my coffee so it was nice and smooth.

title: Absolutely rubbish
body:
I purchased this as a gift in August.

The recipient only opened it this week, she opened it in front of me to ask for instructions on how to use a french press.

She took the lid off so I could show her the plunging mechanism & it literally cracked, no drop or pressure at all, just cracked, not sure how or why at this point.

Unfortunately the Amazon returns window expired and I can't seem to find a way to contact the manufacturer.

I would definitely recommend that you do not buy this ğŸ‘ğŸ½

title: Not for fine coffee granules.
body:

title: 1 Cup per Brew
body: This is a lot smaller than anticipated, reading 3 cup in the description I assumed that it made 3 cups of coffee but it makes barely one. For the price I expected it to be a regular sized French Press such as any I have ever seen before in store. I would recommend going to HomeSense and buying this for $13.99 in a much larger size and different styles rather than spending $17.99 for a French Press built for a Leprechaun.
